title: How sustainable is transparent aluminium? Is it even sustainable? - Quora
tags: Metals and Materials Association, IIT Bombay

response.answer_text: Aluminum itself will never be transparent because (basically) metals aren’t, even when very thin (think of gold leaf). You might be thinking of Aluminium oxynitride - Wikipedia , which is made of very-common non-toxic elements and so is arguably sustainable — but is extremely hard and has a very high melting point, so can’t easily be machined, cast, recycled, etc. Recycling glass, steel, copper, aluminum, and thermoplastics like polyethylene is trivial in comparison.
